intro: Senecio jailicola, commonly known as the Cape Town groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Senecio jailicola is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
